meanings.definition: A print made using the silk-screen process.
meanings.sent1: I bought a beautiful serigraph of a flower for my living room.
meanings.sent2: The art gallery displayed various serigraphs created by local artists.
meanings.sent3: The mischievous cat knocked over the serigraph, leaving ink paw prints everywhere.
meanings.sent4: Her mind was a serigraph of memories, each one vivid and distinct.
meanings.sent5: The serigraph captured the essence of the sunset, with vibrant colors blending seamlessly.

meanings.sent1: The artist will serigraph the design onto the fabric for the t-shirts.
meanings.sent2: She learned how to serigraph her artwork onto paper in her art class.
meanings.sent3: I accidentally serigraphed my hand while trying to make a print.
meanings.sent4: His words seemed to serigraph themselves onto her heart, leaving a lasting impression.
meanings.sent5: The machine hummed softly as it serigraphed the intricate pattern onto the canvas.
